snippet: Many of the officials who are cited in the Justice Department’s scathing report on the city’s justice system are still in power and will be counted on to implement an overhaul.
abstract: Mary Ann Twitty, top court clerk in Ferguson, Mo, is fired for her part in racist emails uncovered by Justice Dept report that found extensive constitutional violations in city's justice system; firing illustrates how difficult it will be to reform city's police department and municipal court when many of its highest officials participated in and tolerated suspect practices.

byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MATT APUZZO
byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Ferguson, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Many of the officials who are cited in the Justice Department’s scathing report on the city’s justice system are still in power and will be counted on to implement an overhaul.

headline.main: Some in Ferguson Who Are Part of Problem Are Asked to Help Solve It
headline.print_headline: Some Who Are Part of Problem in Ferguson Are Asked to Be Part of Solution
